fields.Title: Food Procurement Process: To-Be Workshop Report
fields.Outlet (if applicable): Submitted to process leads and leadership of The Idaho Foodbank
fields.Description/Abstract:
This deliverable was one of several created for a process reengineering effort with The Idaho Foodbank. This technical report summarizes the work of the 8/6/20 To-Be workshop to create a map of the Food Procurement process. The report contained the following:
1.  Introduction 
2. Stakeholders and Success Criteria with Significant Pain Points & Disconnects
3. Takeaways
4. Big Ideas—Major Initiatives Developed In the To-Be Session
     a. Order-ahead budget
     b. “Floater driver” and truck
     c. Expanded perishable storage
     d. Other ideas
5. Major Process Controls that Guide Crucial Activities
6. To-Be Process Diagrams and Detail Tables
     Level 1 Diagram: Overall Food Procurement Model
     2. Level 2 Diagrams
     A. Manufacturer, Processor & Agriculture
     B. Retail Stores
     C. Purchases
     D. Government
APPENDIX: To-Be Workshop: Master Process-Disconnects-Solutions-Implementation Notes Table
